arts.ttl: The mystery of the missing luggage trolleys in Mallorca
arts.sum: After a wave of complaints from passengers and staff about recent building work at Palma airport and then the leaks due to the heavy rain this week it now appears that luggage trolleys have gone missing. The measure affects passengers and staff alike – and is causing increasing discontent in the Son Sant Joan departure terminals.

Mallorca are still on the hunt to finish in the European places as they sit in eighth place in La Liga. Having beaten Real Sociedad 2-0 last time out, they'll be hoping to make it successive victories...

arts.ttl: LaLiga injury news, predicted lineups, fantasy updates
arts.sum: Find out who is missing through injury and who is in a race against time to prove their fitness in Spain's LaLiga this weekend.
There is still plenty to be decided in LaLiga and Joe Champion has previewed all 10 games in the Spanish top flight in week 32.

arts.ttl: Mallorca hoteliers say subsidised holidays for Spain's pensioners are "obsolete"
arts.sum: The Mallorca Hoteliers Federation believes Imserso is in urgent need of an update. The Imserso holidays for Spain's pensioners have been offered since the 1980s.

arts.ttl: World's largest cruise ship heading for Mallorca
arts.sum: Legend of the Seas, which is still under construction in Turku, Finland, will offer eight neighbourhoods onboard, with more than 40 ways to dine and drink, adrenaline-pumping thrills, unrivaled ways to chill, and plenty of ways for holiday -makers to make memories together and on their own, without compromise. “Legend of the Seas is the next bold step in this exciting era of vacations and the continuation of the Icon Class legacy, and we look forward to bringing the revolutionary lineup of experiences to more families and adventurers across Europe, the Caribbean and beyond.”
